website_summaries.verdict: A solid, high-quality flight stick with a rich feature set, although some found the buttons to be lacking.
pros: Features include dual-system aerodynamics control, adjustable resistance, and an internal memory
For use with PC and game consoles
Has a dozen buttons and five axles, all programmable
cons: Assembly is a bit of a hassle
Some felt that this option could use more buttons, or that the ones it did have had an inconsistent feel

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: For the money, it's not too bad. Pros: 1. Inexpensive and no glitches. Works great with X-Plane and MSFS. 2. Lot's of buttons for configuration. 3. Doesn't slide around on the table/desk. Main 3 complaints: 1. squeaky (somewhat, not horrible) 2. Not reversible (a pain to me) 3. Springy and wants to return to center too easily I'm sure a more expensive unit wouldn't have these issues, but just wanted to express my concerns for others that are looking. You can separate the throttle from the stick, however, they will not bolt together on opposing sides. The cable between them is a little short too when they are separated.
customer_reviews.author: VyrysTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: MAC Compatible - works very smoothly.
customer_reviews.text: Totally functional in Mac os Sierra. I have a MacBook Pro 2016 with an Apple usb to usb c converter. All joystick functions work and all buttons are programmable. This should be rated Mac Compatible. The controls separate and consume space on either side of my computer taking little desk space. They are very smooth allowing accurate control. I did not have room for the steering wheel type, though I have one. As a former USAF Crew chief both fighters and jet transportan as an Engineer/Physicist I endorse this device - yes all metal would be fun. PS Edward not Barbara.
customer_reviews.author: Edward R Behnke

customer_reviews.title: Great for VR flight sims
customer_reviews.text: This flight stick really completed my Elite Dangerous setup. Works pretty well with the Oculus Rift since all of the controls are easily found without having to look down. A lot of the more expensive controllers have switches all over the base. It would be REALLY hard to find them when you are wearing VR goggles! So, it's cheap, good quality, and works great for anyone doing flight sims in VR.
customer_reviews.author: N. Mirza

customer_reviews.title: Great first HOTAS that anyone can afford
customer_reviews.text: Currently using this for both Star Citizen and Elite Dangerous; This product works well for these games and were easy to set up. It has an edgy look that seems to be designed for the "gaming" and less for "simulator." It feels pretty cheap but operates well (it is made out of plastic after all), it's still a quality product that feels sturdy. It's well built. The ability to split it apart if you need more room and there's a set of 10 buttons allowing you to map out what you need (I think it can do with some more buttons). Overall it's a great value and a good starting first HOTAS.
customer_reviews.author: Princess Eru

customer_reviews.title: After 1 month it's playable but annoying.
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this HOTAS for a month. Three weeks in and the yaw moves randomly to the left. Sometimes it drifts up or rolls. I've updated drivers, calibrated the controller several times, and used the deadzone function in Elite Dangerous. Nothing stops the random drift from occuring. This leads me to believe that the sensors are of poor quality. I am not hard on controllers or electronics. I am very careful with the equipment I buy. I can't recommend this product. While it worked, it did well. It's still playable, but extremely annoying for doing anything other than trading in Elite. Save your money and buy a better HOTAS.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Crenshaw

customer_reviews.title: Great Joystick and Throttle
customer_reviews.text: So, I bought a used one from an Amazon Warehouse. Essentially, an opened box returned item. It saved me 15 bucks (36 bucks for the throttle and stick) and it works like a champ. All said and done, at the retail price point of 50 bucks, this thing is awesome. I had a Saitek about 10 years ago and this thing makes that joystick look like garbage. The quality of this joystick is very high, enough so that 50 bucks feels like a deal. The gameplay is smooth and works as advertised. Glad that the joystick and throttle separate. Wish they could separate about 2 inches farther, but fits between my keyboard without a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Otto

customer_reviews.title: Works great in Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping that this HOTAS that I bought way back in 2010 would still be compatible with the new Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020 and it is. The game recognized it immediately and had the throttle, stick and all buttons configured and ready to go. I am having a blast flying again and am looking forward to using it in Star Wars Squadrons In October. It amazes me that the manufacturers of these controllers did not anticipate the current demand knowing well in advance of the release of these games. A used T-Flight HOTAS X in good condition like mine that I bought new for $40 ten years ago is now selling for $190 out there right now!
customer_reviews.author: X-Ray Guy

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for a while, but just started using it a lot more for Star Wars Squadrons. After getting the mappings they way that I like in the game, it's working great. Works well with my PC and fully immersive using Oculus Link. Definitely recommended for casual gamers who don't need a fancy full flight-simulator professional quality joystick. Works great for space sims!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Brown

customer_reviews.title: Awesome joystick!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, my old joystick died and I needed a new one for FSX. I was so impressed when I unboxed this stick. It is very well made, nice feel, smooth response, and at this price point you cannot beat it. I plugged it in, auto recognized, fired up FSX, all the buttons were automatically assigned (and to my liking too), and I was flying. So far I have used this about 2 hours and it is great.
customer_reviews.author: Keith A. Goodnough

customer_reviews.title: Great Flight Stick with Throttle, but Throttle Concern
customer_reviews.text: This flight stick by thrustmaster is amazing. The only problem I have is the throttle being too loose. I like resistance in the throttle like most throttles and flight stick, but this one is loose to where if i take it out of position from center, it can drop either to up position or down position without it being able to hold its position by itself. I am not sure if that is normal, but it seems kinda inconvenient to me if you want to keep at a certain speed without have to constantly holding the throttle in that position. Other than that, great buy. Shipping took a day longer than Amazon said for, but great product!
customer_reviews.author: Jasonator2012

customer_reviews.title: Would not purchase again.
customer_reviews.text: Piece of junk. Loved it until it failed after approximately 50 rounds of flight simulation. Hardware causing veering and bleeding. Update: I'm tempted to give it a third star. It's an excellent dog chew toy after it stops working. I think I was too hard on it's ability to be used as a flight control device.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff (Laluna)

customer_reviews.title: Cool to try
customer_reviews.text: At this pricepoint, this is the "try hotas to see if you like it" hotas and it's a good entry into the genre. Feels tough, buttons are where you expect + a few you don't. Elite-dangerous default binds no landing gear which is F-ing CRIMINAL, FIX THAT, ED, GEEZ. Don't blame the hotas for that, unless they wrote the config in which case HOW AM I SUPPOSED TO DO ANYTHING WITHOUT LANDING GEAR CONTROLS? FLY TO ANDROMEDA W LANDING GEAR OUT = NOT COOL, BREAU.
customer_reviews.author: Tobias L Merriman

customer_reviews.title: Cheap junk.
customer_reviews.text: Worked really well for a few months, then just crapped out on me. There is some sort of issue causing the trigger buttons to randomly fire without my touching them so now I cannot leave the dock I'm docked at in Elite Dangerous because every time I try to leave it auto fires inside and gets me killed by security. I thought this deal was too good to be true. I was right.
customer_reviews.author: E. Goff

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and set up
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this controller for use with X-Plane 11. It works flawlessly and is very easy to reassign buttons to X-Plane, MS Flight Simulator and MS Flight. You can adjust the back pressure if you like, I like it as is. The unit is heavy enough that it does not move while flying any of the aircraft. The throttle portion can be disconnected if desired, I do not, and there is a cool feature on it that allows you to assign the axis on front to quickly view all positions right and left. I am very happy with the unit and would recommend it to anyone serious about flying on a PC.
customer_reviews.author: Jim W

customer_reviews.title: Became unusable a few months after purchas.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in August and it was fine at first. A few months after purchasing I was playing elite dangerous and doing some mining and my ship was acting very strange. I took my hands off both sides and my ship kept on moving. I uninstalled and reinstalled and it didn't help. I tried calibrating and during the calibration noticed the the slider was jumping back and forth and without any input. I put in a ticket almost a week ago and haven't heard anything back. I am going to continue to pursue help through thrustmaster but so far my experience with their products and customer support have not been good at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Caution Regarding Reliability
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the product in 2017 which came with a 1 year warranty. It worked well until 2019 when the yaw axis began to not respond. I emailed ThrustMaster USA with the problem description, receipt, and other pictures. It took two weeks for a reply. They acknowledged a hardware issue but because it was out of warranty, there was no remedy offered. The product was well cared for and should have lasted for more that 2 years.
customer_reviews.author: Jeisen

customer_reviews.title: 800 hours and still flying through space
customer_reviews.text: I've put 800 hours onto this thing. it developd the tiniest defect of a left yaw that I was able to counter by setting a small "deadzone in the game's controls (elite dangerous) and it squeaks just a hair, but those issues didn't start until 400 hours in. when this thing finally dies I will replace it with an exact copy. Very comfortable, plenty of buttons, and if you're looking at something for specifically Elite dangerous, some of the fancier HOTAS setups have a flaw that the throttle only goes forward so you have to button toggle to reverse. this has full range and is the cheapest HOTAS out there. Not just would by again. WILL buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Shank

customer_reviews.title: Cheap - good and bad
customer_reviews.text: This is the cheapest recommended HOTAS for playing Elite Dangerous. It lasted about a year for me. The yaw sensor broke, followed by the throttle position sensor. For a while you can work around the unwanted yaw inputs by damping the responsiveness in your settings, but there comes a time when that won't work anymore. And it's hard to go to full throttle when something has slipped apart inside. Still, I bought another one recently. I can play a few years before buying a Warthog would be more cost effective.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin P. Griffis

customer_reviews.title: Huge deadzone while centered
customer_reviews.text: X-Plane 11 and MSFS 2020 both suffer from the huge dead zone on the stick and the center detent in the throttle which makes fine throttle adjustments very difficult when in the detent. I loved all the buttons which, when programmed, enabled me to have all the commands I needed at my fingertips. I cannot recommend it for MSFS 2020 and it's sort of usable with X-Plane. I ended up going to a T.1600 system and its hall-effect sensors which cost about double but works much better.
customer_reviews.author: Sparks601

customer_reviews.title: Great price - Good compatibility - Fair build quality
customer_reviews.text: If you buy it on sale it's a fantastic value. Seems to work with just about every flight I game own, although most of the games did not provide default button configurations - meaning you will spend a fair amount of time setting them up yourself (I presume this would also be the case with other brand flight sticks). Stick feels great. The thrust feels pretty cheap though. It's also a tad lifeless without any sort of rumble or feedback. Still, your best option if looking to save money.
customer_reviews.author: MHaddad

customer_reviews.title: Still works 10 Years later! No regrets.
customer_reviews.text: It still works nearly 10 years later. I have used it with countless different video games and don't remember any problems with it. Back then they still hadn't figured out the force feedback. It was really hard to get hold of the rather good discontinued Microsoft force feedback and even if you could it might cost you a good chunk of change. Some people still don't like the force feedback and I understand that. If you can find one of these in good condition, I don't see why it wouldn't last you 10+ years of gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt M.

customer_reviews.title: Intro Joystick
customer_reviews.text: This joystick is plug and play. I did not have to change anything to get it to work with FSX. The instructions have the keys already mapped out for it and you can reference it while playing. There is some deadness to the thrust control and if you move it very slightly, it wont register the movement. This is my first joystick I've used and am happy with it. It's a good intro joystick and its realatively cheap so I'd recommend it for anyone getting in to flying games.
customer_reviews.author: A. Schmitt

customer_reviews.title: Excellent entry level flight stick.
customer_reviews.text: WOW! Why did I wait so long to get a HOTAS? This Flight stick is super affordable, completely programmable and very easy to use with adjustments for everything necessary in any flight based game. The stick and thrust separate and there is enuff cord between them to put the stick on the right of the keyboard and the thrust on the left with 2 inches to spare on a standard sized keyboard with numeric ten key extension. Next is to mount it on my chair for a more realistic cockpit set up. If you are looking to enter into using a HOTAS get this stick to see if it is for you.
customer_reviews.author: B. Bryne

customer_reviews.title: Great for price - needs more buttons
customer_reviews.text: Just got into Elite Dangerous not too long ago and bought this HOTAS setup. Excellent for beginners and for the price, however after some time with the game and the controllers I was left wanting more. I still have to resort to the keyboard for some functions, it would be nice to have more buttons to map to. Still can't bring myself to spend over 2x the price for a more "serious" setup though.
customer_reviews.author: brandon terrill

customer_reviews.title: Bought for Elite Dangerous
customer_reviews.text: As stated, I got this for Elite Dangerous. It takes some doing to set it up in-game. Which-to be fair, all controls take a bit of doing to set up in that... BUT. it works well! It makes Deep Core mining a breeze and fun! I've not noticed any looseness or stickiness in any of the buttons, levers or switches and yeah! Solid starter! The USB cable IS a little... short. Really short. it's really really short. So there's that.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: A good hotas
customer_reviews.text: I am using it to play Elite Dangerous. Works pretty good in the game. I think the game is losing some of the settings and they have to be reset. A good hotas for the price. If you like sci fi sims I don't think you need to spend $450 for a hotas setup. It has 12 buttons. Enough to assign what you need to get the job done. Update: 4/13/18 In the last few months the stick has gotten this aggravating way of steering my ship to the left. It is almost constant. Not good. I have an email into Thrustmaster support. Still waiting for a response.
customer_reviews.author: mathman54

customer_reviews.title: Still got it...
customer_reviews.text: Thought these were gone for good! Just wanted a great flight stick for my pc for mechwarrior 4:mercenaries (and mechwarrior 5 when it comes out next year.). Great as I remember, adjustable, separable, awesome product. **Edit, 4/10/17** Still going strong, if anyone needs a list of which ps3/pc games this stick will work for, please visit the manufacturer's website. They are always updating the list. I know it works for the old mechwarrior games for pc, as well as the X-Wing Vs Tie Fighter titles. Those are the only games I have personal experience with.
customer_reviews.author: Big Jim

customer_reviews.title: A curiosity become a pastime...and now becoming a proficiency.
customer_reviews.text: I have learned to "pilot" in the virtual world above my hometown of Dillingham, AK. a Cessna 152. And have flown it to every village the local mail and passenger carriers fly to daily. Even getting proficient doing crosswind taxing, takeoffs, cross country flights and landings. Have also learned to "pilot" WWII fighter aircraft, the P-51 Mustang, the P-47 Thunderbolt or "Jug." Plus a Wildcat and even a Japanese "Zero"., aircraft used in "The Pacific Theater" of WWII. Also have become in my opinion "a savvy" fighter pilot...at least now not being shot down regularly or flying my aircraft into the ground inadvertently not minding my "altitude above ground level..."
customer_reviews.author: Robert Koweluk

customer_reviews.title: Makes Elite Dangerous more Fun
customer_reviews.text: Great Hotas joystick for the price. The only issue is occasionally the controls will slowly slide in one direction, but quickly fixed when I quickly start turning it to its extremes to make it work again. Creaks a lot, but for the price, it cannot be beat especially since playing Elite Dangerous is so much more fun now. There are also a ton of buttons, and you can also use one or more buttons like a shift button(5 + L3) and double or triple your buttons on the joystick.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck E

customer_reviews.title: Would not load! It did not come with a ...
customer_reviews.text: Would not load! It did not come with a drivers disk, so it refused to load! Please help and i will change rating
customer_reviews.author: dsullivan

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value!! Won't disappoint!!
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing value considering both function and reliability. I'm a big fan of Aces High, DCS World, and IL-2. After spending time in calibration and controller mapping, this HOTAS suits my needs. I suppose, if I were a bit more hardcore, I would want something a bit heavier with more toggle switches. But considering I got everything I needed for $50, I'm not complaining. I've spent hours playing Aces High bombing missions and rarely notice any discomfort. The lack of force feedback is the only real CON on this entry level HOTAS.
customer_reviews.author: Squatch82

customer_reviews.title: works well. im happy
customer_reviews.text: wanted an inexpensive hotus to try out Elite and Dangerous and for the money, its great. i use this and an oculus and i cant get enough. i was thinking of getting a hotus with more buttons after playing for a while as you have to use a combination to map all the commands, basically using the 5,6,7 buttons as shift buttons to triple up on all the other ones, but the more expensive ones all have their own issues so i think im going to stick with this setup.
customer_reviews.author: Micheal Davis

customer_reviews.title: It's a good option.  I prefer the single stick though.
customer_reviews.text: Unless you have dedicated space for this, it's pretty clunky to install and re-install as it is two separate pieces that come apart easily. That's good for a sense of realism, but as a renter of a small space, it just can't sit out for me. I think the abundance of controls on it is really good, but I haven't used it enough to really enjoy those aspects. I routinely use my single stick with the throttle as a little tab on it that is more convenient than this combo. But I'd actually buy it again most likely if my circumstances were different.
customer_reviews.author: SFO Bro

customer_reviews.title: Panoramic view does not work.
customer_reviews.text: I was super excited to play War Thunder on this when I got it and programmed all the buttons (only 10 out of 12 are programmable). I got on to my first match and I was looking at my plane upside-down, I tried to move the panoramic view button but it wouldn't look straight and then it would pop back to me looking at my plane from every angle that would be impossible to fly none-the-less fly fight in. I reconfigured the controls multiple times but I kept on having the same problem. I am returning this.
customer_reviews.author: Alisa T.

customer_reviews.title: ... it being the cheap model it performs just as good as the more expensive ones
customer_reviews.text: For it being the cheap model it performs just as good as the more expensive ones. The body is plastic but it is well made and the buttons are configured in the right places.If your looking for a hotas and are on a budget don't hesitate to purchase this one. Its simple plug and play is great. I am using it for Elite Dangerous and its made the game so much more fun to play
customer_reviews.author: Danny Smith

customer_reviews.title: Awesome controls for Elite Dangerous
customer_reviews.text: I'm playing Elite Dangerous through the Oculus Rift VR and this HOTAS flight stick works great! No more having to use the keyboard to fly me around while wearing the VR headset.. this flight stick has all the controls I need once properly set up.
customer_reviews.author: D-Man

customer_reviews.title: Works great for Star Wars Galaxies Jump to Lightspeed
customer_reviews.text: Works well, and a great price. I wish the cord between the stick and throttle was longer so I could do a wider ergo setup. I think there could probably also be better materials to prevent chafing. However, for the price, the quality is pretty good and it works quite well.
customer_reviews.author: Al Barrus

customer_reviews.title: awesome
customer_reviews.text: the ONLY complaint i have is that i wish the cable management was slightly better. You can separate the joystick and throttle control to either side of your keyboard (which is awesome as hell), but then have 2 GIANT wires going every witch way but where you want them to go. There is a recess in the underside of both halves to let you wrap the cords and keep em hidden, but the ratios make it either to close together to be of use, or absolutely no help at all and everything is all over your desk.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Miller

customer_reviews.title: Good Flight Stick
customer_reviews.text: This product works well with "Birds Of Steel" and probably general Flight Simulators. I have been unable to use the Joystick (in normal fashion) with racing games, however the manual indicates a modification/disabling can be made to the under-side of the rudder to address this but I prefer not to attempt that and just use this product for Flight. That said, the fact that you can via a "switch" use this product with a PS3 or a PC is genius. Good Purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Maxxey

customer_reviews.title: Twist Feature on the Joystick went out after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: This is my first HOTAS. I have only played Elite Dangerous with this Flight stick. After 3 months of use the twist sensors in the stick are so messed up I had to disable them so that I could keep on a straight flight path. I contacted Thrustmaster regarding this as it is well within their warranty. They ended up sending a 3 page list of instructions on how to possibly fix the issue. None of these suggestions have worked. I don't understand why they wouldn't offer an RMA for something like this. I guess I should of gone with Logitech. Update: 12/4/2019 now another set of buttons have started to go.... wonderful product
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Thrustmaster T-Flight Hotas Joystick - Affordable and fills the entry - occasional player ticket...a must have for a flight sim.
customer_reviews.text: Get starter joystick combo.... (Throttle and Joystick) I'm currently playing Elite Dangerous... Started playing the game with an XBox One Controller (hated it)... The game was cumbersome and flying awkward, especially between switching between controller and keyboard... and god help if you need to text someone while doing anything.... The Hotas Joystick combo is awesome... Flying is easy... combat much more controlled... switching hands to use keyboard is easy.... Well worth the money.... Buy one now if you don't have a joystick hotas combo...
customer_reviews.author: Robert W Abbey

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Good value for entry level HOTAS, that can not be disputed. However, there is the DEADZONE issue. It is quite large near the center of the stick and also near its extreme deflection limit. The Deadzone is also on the throttle at the midpoint, which is quite annoying. I'm not talking about the center detent, but there is a definite and large deadzone that makes throttle response effectively two stages, 0-40% then 60%-100%. Forget this HOTAS if these things sound annoying to you. I returned it and got the 'Thrustmaster T-16000M FCS Hotas' and I'm much happier.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Does the job.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good product. Works with My playstation 3 and Birds of Steel. The only real issues are that, as others have mentioned, there are some pretty big dead zones in the center of the control in all axes which makes it difficult to fly in simulation mode without constantly over-correcting. The other issue is that it doesn't have as many buttons as the PS3 controller which means you have to re-program the buttons for different things depending on what kind of plane your flying and in what mode.
customer_reviews.author: Sailorcurt

customer_reviews.title: I am very pleased with this controller
customer_reviews.text: Wow. I am very pleased with this controller. I started playing Microsoft FSX a month ago, but had a very old Logitech extreme 3d pro controller. It is just worn out and it is Super frustrating to have it inconsistent with weird anomalies while trying to learn to fly. I decided to order a new controller and I saw this had very favorable reviews. I can happily report that I am stunned at how well this thing performs. It feels great in the hands too. I don't know about longevity for the controller, but the action is excellent in my opinion. I would highly recommend this controller. Hats off to the designers of this controller.
customer_reviews.author: T. Korabek

customer_reviews.title: this is the perfect entry level device
customer_reviews.text: Read about this in multiple articles and thought I'd give it a try. If you're just getting into flight simulation, this is the perfect entry level device. Not too many buttons, fits nicely on any size desk, and cheap. Highly recommend for beginners looking to get their first joy stick.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: good for the money
customer_reviews.text: For the $40 price point, the build quality of this is great. Personally, I found that I'm actually better controlling a fighter aircraft simulator/game with a PS3 controller than with a flight stick. But if you want a flight stick setup, this is great at the price point. BTW, it's not apparent in a lot of the descriptions and photos you'll see for this product, but the stick and throttle parts can detach from each other. They're connected by a cable, on the bottom of the units, and the cable can go up to approx. the width of armchair arms. If you need more distance, or the cable not stretched, you'll have to do some soldering.
customer_reviews.author: amabostonian

customer_reviews.title: Works, but noisy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for Elite Dangerous, and it does it's job. No complaints with the X and Y axis, buttons, or anything like that. But it does squeak when moving the rudder axis. I imagine I could spray it with WD40 or something but I'm not sure if that would cause damage inside. Other than the squeaking though, it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn M

customer_reviews.title: Some buttons and hatswitch don't work as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Hatswitch does not work. My games would recognize the hatswitch, but only see it as one button regardless of direction I pushed the hatswitch. The rocker slider on the throttle worked, but sometimes it would have slight erratic fluctuations when I wasn't using it. The throttle has a "hump" in the dead center of its range of travel, which I found annoying. Upgraded to a Thrustmaster T16000M FCS HOTAS, and did not have any of these problems. Good points: ergonomically, the joystick is very smooth and stable - more so than most other joysticks I have used.
customer_reviews.author: Thorfinn

customer_reviews.title: Great for Elite Dangerous!  Makes it a better game instantly!
customer_reviews.text: Great controller. I use mine for Elite Dangerous as well as ARMA 3 when flying in planes and choppers. If you are looking at this controller for either of those, you can't go wrong. Great price! I have had mine for two years now and it still works great.
customer_reviews.author: TD Bauer

customer_reviews.title: Not good for flight Microsoft Flight Sim
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use with my Microsoft FSX Simulator, and it is a disappointment. Programming it for use with MS FSX is difficult if not impossible for me. Trim tab can be adjusted for nose up but not nose down, and the trim can't be returned to neutral without restarting the sim. Other issues dealing with sensitivity of the controls make the Thrustmaster useless for any serious flight simulation. Good for games, I suppose, which the low price indicates. Pilots and aspiring pilots will have to invest considerably more money if they want a flight control package that works well with MS FSX.
customer_reviews.author: John Strathmore

customer_reviews.title: Good stick, terrible throttle
customer_reviews.text: Picked this up based on the wirecutter recommendation so that I could get back into the old Star Wars flight sims when Steam had a sale. The stick is fine and the button response is crisp, but the throttle is floppy and has zero tension in it. It’s way too easy to slam the throttle from zero to full and almost impossible to accurately hit any other power setting by feel.
customer_reviews.author: B4E1

customer_reviews.title: Great quality! I love it.
customer_reviews.text: I love it. The build quality of this HOTAS is spectacular considering the price. I would absolutely recommend this to anyone getting started with a flight sim. I use mine for Elite Dangerous and it’s great. Sure, it could use more buttons but it’s definitely adequate. I use mine separated with my keyboard in the middle and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: nik

customer_reviews.title: Its a good stick.
customer_reviews.text: Its a good stick....HOWEVER. I still like my Saitek joystick for flightsim better than this controller. Heres why: The THROTTLE on this unit should have some resistance to it. It seems very loose. Also, the center detent while cool, is a pain. I dont want to stop at 50% thrust at any given time. NOW IF I could figure out how to program the center point as IDLE thrust and reverser activation below that, that would be neat.... Overall, its got a nice build, but its just not for me....I'll be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: KCM

customer_reviews.title: Button layout is pretty natural, and the give/feel of the stick and ...
customer_reviews.text: Use this solely with Elite Dangerous. One of the default control scemes works really well, but you can customize the layout if that's your thing. Button layout is pretty natural, and the give/feel of the stick and throttle is nice. Connecting cord is long enough to sit each half just outside the arms of a standard office chair. Thumbs up.
customer_reviews.author: Mikey 'Killer'

customer_reviews.title: Not Enough Buttons
customer_reviews.text: I got this for Elite: Dangerous and there is not enough buttons on it for all my keybinds. Will definitely not fully replace your keyboard and mouse. And with the cable connecting the stick and the throttle as short as it is it wasn't able to fit the keyboard in between leading to an awkward desk setup. It's fine for what it is: a cheap entry point for HOTAS. The build quality is good and seemed sturdy all around. Though I didn't like the extra markings on the buttons that correspond to a console controller. (such as L1, L2, L3, R1, etc.) Seemed primarily designed as a console HOTAS.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Solid, affordable controller
customer_reviews.text: Sure it's not top of the line, but works great. The way it connects is a bit weird, and the cord that connects them is just enough. Just don't expect for use in like a custom setup that require more distance between the throttle and stick. Feels solid, buttons are ok placing wise and trim buttons on throttle are very convenient. Not disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Eric C.

customer_reviews.title: Throttle fell forward on its own
customer_reviews.text: I did not like the fact that when I tried using the throttle, it didn’t stick in position and just fell forward, would recommend the more pricy options
customer_reviews.author: Thebrevvv

customer_reviews.title: Can't get better for the price
customer_reviews.text: I picked this up specifically for ED. Game changer. Honestly for the $40 I spent on this, I really can't imagine something better without spending the extra $100. Stick feels perfect in terms of dead zone and resistance/return, throttle is fluid and smooth in movement. I will say though I would really love some kind of toggle that remaps all the controls on the fly like my keyboard macros, but, setting the throttle buttons as modifiers (shift+, alt+, ctrl+) you really do get a perfect setup. And, when separated, fits like a glove around my G105 which worried me cause of the macro row.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised.
customer_reviews.text: Just got this thing today. So far it's pretty impressed. I'm playing Elite Dangerous Horizons with it. I download a profile from the web for the game and I have to say compared to my old Sidewinder 3D, this thing is a dream to play with. I read one of the questions about this product saying that the throttle and joystick when disconnected aren't stable. Well I thought so too until I realized you have to make sure the cable is seated properly. Flip these things over and you'll find channels that the cable are supposed to be fitted into. Once you do this the throttle and joystick are as stable as when connected.
customer_reviews.author: P. Klissas

customer_reviews.title: terrible product no support.
customer_reviews.text: had to return it. because there is no support. and was never told about that before I bought it. also didn't know it supported only 2 or 3 games on steam. either buy the new model or a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.Review

customer_reviews.title: Performs all functions as desired
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a piece of hardware that cost twice as much. This has more features. Installed on a Windows 10 box without issue. Thank You!!
customer_reviews.author: Paulus Maximus

customer_reviews.title: Elite: Dangerous
customer_reviews.text: I use it for Elite:Dangerous. Works well with the game. Needed to adjust some bindings, but playable on default settings. It does the job, but I do have several issues though: 1) Its so light that it comes off the desk too easily and the feet aren't enough to keep it stable. 2) The cord connecting the throttle and stick is annoying. You need to use you're keyboard for some functions, but its barely long enough to wrap it around my keyboard and out of the way. 3) Its cheap. From the plastic quality to the squeaking every time I move the stick, the cheap materials are very apparent.
customer_reviews.author: MN

customer_reviews.title: The Thrustmaster T-Flight Hotas X is an exceptional value in price, quality and every way.
customer_reviews.text: I have been very pleased thus far with the Thrustmaster T flight Hotas. It is very well made and excellent quality for the price paid. Anyone that has spent any time looking for a decent joystick or flight stick, has been stunned how expensive some many of these products can be. Well, I can not afford to spend hundreds of dollars on a flight stick. I certainly could afford approx $50 and I am happy with my choice. I rarely give out 5 stars because I think an item must be an exceptional value in price, quality, and use. This product reaches that rare pinnacle.
customer_reviews.author: Brian K.

customer_reviews.title: Great flight stick for VR space combat
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the Hotas X as my primary 'controller' for the VR version of Elite:Dangerous (specifically the Oculus Rift and a PC setup). The controller isn't recognized by the game until you mouse-focus (click) on the Elite Dangerous window. However, once enabled, it's pure immersion into space-based trading and combat. I haven't messed with the reprogrammable buttons (yet), though this is on my to-do list. Overall a great controller and perfect for this particular game!
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Hodges

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: The thing is just too large, thanks to the extra plastic you lose a lost of desk space to these things. The throttle doesn't hold its place so it's really a forward or backwards toggle. The joystick is extra springy offers no resistance. Finally, Windows 10 doesn't recognize it so you have to go hunt on Thrustmaster's late 90's website for a driver pack.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Harnach

customer_reviews.title: Nice HOTAS stick for a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: When my old joystick died I went looking for a new one. This one works on both PC and PS3 (which I still have sitting under my TV) and was a HOTAS setup. When I got the "used" stick it looked NIB and still had what looked like original wraps on the cords. The joystick and throttle work well, the only real complaint I have is the stop on the throttle halfway up. There is no adjustment of the stop, and it makes you "hiccup" when trying to smoothly increase the throttle. If you are on a budget and are looking for a HOTAS stick that doesn't cost $300 you should check this one out.
customer_reviews.author: Bob and Juno

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Joy Stick and Throttle
customer_reviews.text: This is a great Joy Stick and Throttle. It works exactly as advertised. However, I have to echo many of the other reviewers and tell you that; the connecting cord between the Joy Stick and Throttle is too short. If they had added another 6 inches of cable it would have been perfect.
customer_reviews.author: C. Nubel

customer_reviews.title: Worked.. for a while
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use with Elite and Star Citizen. It worked for a couple months before the throttle started to loosen and crap out in a dangerous (in-game, mind you) way. The horizonal wiggle it developed began sending phantom acceleration/deceleration input, making precision control more or less impossible. I ended up mapping my throttle to preset % hotkeys after fiddling with it for a while, trying to use rubber bands to hold it in place, and a number of other MacGuyver solutions. Not sure if this is just my particular unit or all units, but I will be replacing it with a different model.
customer_reviews.author: Valued Prime Member

customer_reviews.title: Great HOTAS System for a Great Price
customer_reviews.text: I have had this product for about a month now and I love it. I use it mostly for Elite Dangerous. The plug and play aspect makes for a very good user experience. Pros: -Extremely comfortable to use for long periods of time. -Easy to set up. -Adjustable tension on the joystick. Can be pretty sensitive with light movement. -For the price it looks and feels great. Cons: -It does feel on the cheap side. -Cord that attaches the two modules could be longer. Overall a great product. I have recommended this product to many of my friends who are avid gamers.
customer_reviews.author: Roderick

customer_reviews.title: I've been playing Elite Dangerous with an Oculus Rift daily ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been playing Elite Dangerous with an Oculus Rift daily for ten months now, using this Hotas. With the exception of one button that has become a little loose, this controller has performed flawlessly. I recently though I would upgrade to a "big boy" controller, so I bought an X-55. A day later I boxed up the X-55 and sent it back - I realized there was no need to upgrade and I missed what I had been accustomed to.
customer_reviews.author: Kasey

customer_reviews.title: Just needs a bit more friction
customer_reviews.text: Used for Flight Simulation, it is precise and allows for gentle turns with a nice degree of resistance on the joystick. On the negative side, the throttle is top heavy, such that it is hard to locate it at one setting and have it stay there. An adjustable friction brake would be a good addition. A nice feature is the ability to separate the throttle from the joystick, but sadly for me, the interconnecting cable is just too short to span a Microsoft Ergonomic Keyboard..
customer_reviews.author: Debra  L. Connor

customer_reviews.title: It works great and got the job done
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted a HOTAS for Elite Dangerous and this was the lowest price range. It works great and got the job done. There are plenty of buttons and button configurations to use that met my needs. The distance between the two controls is a little short for my liking though. One of my favorite features is that you can twist the right joystick left and right.
customer_reviews.author: Dirty Hippie

customer_reviews.title: This is a great entry level stick!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great entry level stick! I was pleasantly surprised by the look and feel of this flight stick. I fly several flight simulators and they all recognize the flight stick at instillation and setup. There are many ways in which to customize this stick including separating it into two separate components. The price is very affordable as well. For my level of flight, its perfect. I would definitely recommend this stick for any entry lever flight sim enthusiast.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Great joystick, but I got a lemon.
customer_reviews.text: I like this joystick, I bought it for Elite Dangerous but unfortunately the one I purchased from Amazon had a defect from the box. The throttle would register as neutral when pushed all the way forward, and full reverse when in neutral position. Amazon was able to promptly handle the return and I purchased one from a local retailer and tested it before I brought it home. The defect I experienced seems to be a common issue with this model, it has to do with a manufacturing failure and Thrustmaster did offer to replace my product but Amazon was able to refund me quickly. Good customer service all around, good product, just unfortunate luck.
customer_reviews.author: James Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Hasn't worked (yet) for its intended purpose.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically to learn Flight Simulator X (Steam Edition), but I have yet been able to get it to work. My computer recognizes it. I can open the diagnostics and see everything working, but it will not work in FSX. I'm sure I've done something wrong, but I've tried everything--uninstalling/reinstalling FSX, Driver updates, hard re-boot...nothing works. If someone can help, I'd be very appreciative.
customer_reviews.author: M. Read

customer_reviews.title: Good unit, but not for MechWarrior
customer_reviews.text: In this price range, it is probably the best one you can buy, but not for MechWarrior 4 Mercenaries. The right hand unit is comfortable, but lacking buttons. The left hand unit is not as comfortable, though the amount of buttons is sufficient. It has good weight and does not slip. If you need a H.O.T.A.S. for playing MechWarrior games, DO NOT BUY THIS ONE. Otherwise, it is most likely good for everything else. For the price, it is good, but not for MechWarrior.
customer_reviews.author: Gunzon

customer_reviews.title: Well made, works like a dream.
customer_reviews.text: Few things bring you back to childhood like grabbing a joy stick and whipping it every which way but loose until you've had your satisfaction. But seriously, for the price this thing really does hold up. It's not exactly heavy duty, but at the same time it's not poorly made. The controls respond well and the buttons are all in very comfortable and easy to reach spots. When it's combined it stays in a nice, tight area and when pulled apart it's still easy to position and use. Great addition for any space/flight sims.
customer_reviews.author: Luke D.

customer_reviews.title: Plug and Play
customer_reviews.text: It came a little dirty but everything plugged right in and worked from the start. The hex driver used to detach the throttle from the joystick was clearly not the normal included in because I had to rip it out of the bottom of the joystick. Pretty pleased with it overall and look forward to seeing Elite Dangerous in VR
customer_reviews.author: Newegg B.

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected.  Good value!
customer_reviews.text: For the price, I thought this flight stick might be a little bit flimsy or cheesy. It was not. Its rock solid. Has just the right amount of features I was looking for to play Elite Dangerous. I love that the throttle and flight stick can lock together, or you can separate them further apart. You cant go wrong with this item for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: great for the money.
customer_reviews.text: It's a tad plasticy (because it's made of plastic - duh!), but for a hotas under 50 bucks, I didn't expect anything else. It works perfectly for playing Elite Dangerous. The cable between the two parts is just long enough to fit my keyboard between. it could have done with being a little longer as I wanted to mount the two parts to a chair, but that's a minor thing. This is excellent value.
customer_reviews.author: Julie C.

customer_reviews.title: I always wanted to have one of this...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for Iracing, I will convert that stick to a e-break, it actually works! but I did play with it for a mean time like Grand theft Auto V, it was ok, I just downloaded a third party software to make it work, I tried other games too, and it works just fine. Not into flying games though, if ever I would, this is not the one I would buy, it lacks force feedback.
customer_reviews.author: PogiProblems

customer_reviews.title: I think it's way too easy to push or pull
customer_reviews.text: I've only got two issues with it, but they're both semi major issues for me. 1. The throttle doesn't have any adjustments. I think it's way too easy to push or pull. I wish that you could stiffen it a bit, like you can the joystick. 2. The joystick squeaks a bit when you move it slowly, and has a bit more of a deadzone than I'm used to, but I was coming from a Logitech Extreme 3D Pro or whatever it's called.
customer_reviews.author: Will Greenfield

customer_reviews.title: Big disappointment
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a particular PS3 WW II flight game, as I thought using it would make the game more realistic/fun. Unfortunately, it was clunky to use when it worked, and it would not work at all for some game functions. So I threw it away and switched to the regular PS3 controller.
customer_reviews.author: Bret

customer_reviews.title: Good economical choice.
customer_reviews.text: So far it seems to be working well. Having the rudder on the joystick is preferable for me than to have to find space for rudder pedals. The one thing I would change is the length of the wire connecting the two parts of the device. It needs to be at least 6 inches longer to allow the two parts to sit on opposite sides of my 15" laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Nelson W

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: This joystick is great for both my budget and my gaming experience. The only thing I can say bad about this joystick is that it has a little bit of delay when using it. It's barely noticeable, but since I use it to combat land helicopters, every millisecond of delay can make me crash. 4/5
customer_reviews.author: Luis F.

customer_reviews.title: NOT for gamers. Strictly for flight enthusiasts.
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly from what I could tell. But be aware! GAMERS, this is not an arcade joystick, if you think you can fly with this thing, think again! See how it works before you buy. I frustratingly worked with this thing for hours only to realize that this is for flight enthusiasts, not joystick gamers! You need extreme practice to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Darth Steampunk

customer_reviews.title: this controller is otherwise very good, responsive
customer_reviews.text: The stick has a very large mechanical dead zone that cannot be adjusted. If you demand ultra-fine-tuned sensitivity from your peripherals, this device will not suit you. If you're okay with a sizeable dead zone on your joysticks, this controller is otherwise very good, responsive, and feels durable.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought this a long time ago.
customer_reviews.text: This is an extremely good value. I wanted a yoke, but after reading a bazillion reviews it didn't seem like anyone was truly happy with what is available on the market. These also take up a lot less space than a yoke, and I like the rudder buttons on the throttle quadrant which so far leaves me with no need to buy pedals. Works seamlessly with XPlane 11.
customer_reviews.author: D. Troyer

customer_reviews.title: Decent but the quality is lacking in my opinion.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the sole purpose of playing Elite Dangerous....ok so the game saw it...and Win10 configured it...and its a HOTAS....but. The Throttle stick is flimsy and has poor feedback...feels incredibly cheap. The Yoke is decent enough, heavy base...adjustable resistance but lacks enough buttons to be really useful. I guess thats what I get for trying to get in on the cheap. I think I will be grabbing one of the more expensive HOTAS setups.
customer_reviews.author: Paulmuaddib

customer_reviews.title: Excellent choice for the money.
customer_reviews.text: A fantastic joystick for the money. If you're looking to spend under $100 this is the joystick for you. I bought this to play Elite Dangerous on PC. It has served quite well for my approximately 100 hours of play time at the time of review (November 8th, 2015). There are better joysticks out there, but you'll easily pay 2-3 times as much money. If you're an entry level gamer that's unsure if spending $200 on a joystick is a good idea, buy this one instead.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Austin R. Lathrop

customer_reviews.title: Best Bang for the Buck
customer_reviews.text: I started playing Elite Dangerous, and wanted the best experience possible. Keyboard and mouse wasn't great, Dualshock 3 & 4 both sucked, so I decided to get this. It's a great HOTAS at an affordable price. Works right out of the box, and is already mapped for Elite Dangerous. Can't wait to use it on my other flight and space sims.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew W.

customer_reviews.title: Great game stick
customer_reviews.text: Game stick works great and kuddos to the designer who has the thrust control separate from the joy stick. That way you can space them to what is most comfortable for you. Works great and has a lot of options for binding different functions to various controls.
customer_reviews.author: CDB

customer_reviews.title: Works with Mac and X-Plane 11
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this hoping to use it for some military aircraft games on my PS3, but to my pleasant surprise it works like a charm with X-Plane on my Macbook! This 2-piece set seems to be a great bargain for how realistic the setup is.
customer_reviews.author: Madeleine Albright

customer_reviews.title: Trashmaster Hunka S
customer_reviews.text: Absolute garbage. Lasted 6 months. Hat died. Intermittent functionality and that annoying cable across your lap.
customer_reviews.author: Bdub

customer_reviews.title: This works well for my Flight Sim
customer_reviews.text: I am an avid X-Plane user, and without having to invest in a formal yoke/pedal/throttle combo, this nicely suits my purposes. I yet have to run into any issues with quality. It feels fairly sturdy, is well-weighted and not overly-glitchy as far as responsiveness goes. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: ThoughtGarden

customer_reviews.title: Great stick. Great price.
customer_reviews.text: Great system. Great price. It’s an older model, but it still does everything I need. I’ve been playing a lot of Elite Dangerous in VR and this takes the immersion to the top level. Comes apart and the cable length is very workable. I personally use it together for stability on my lap. Couldn’t be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Brett Cochran

customer_reviews.title: Awesome controls for pilots on the ground
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift to go with Microsoft Flight Simulator. It can be used for many other games too!!! He loved it!!! He is a pilot but it has been years since he has flown but he said it was a great refresher course!
customer_reviews.author: L. Gilchrist

customer_reviews.title: Just amazing value for the price
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this flight stick to be an interim stick while I saved up for a really nice one, but when I got this thing I couldn't believe the quality of what I got for the price. It's made out of very sturdy metal and thick plastic. The HOTAS separates from the stick and is also very nice. I can't recommend a better value for the price. This thing is worth every penny and I highly recommend it if you can't afford the $100 or more options.
customer_reviews.author: Dan The Man

customer_reviews.title: Instantly dissatisfied.
customer_reviews.text: Throttle notch makes this product incredibly frustrating to use seriously. Smooth throttle input is nearly impossible, as applying the necessary force to push the throttle out of the notch will cause the throttle to jerk forward or back. It's a seriously retarded idea to implement on an analog input. The stick also has annoyingly inconsistent resistance and feels very mushy all around, even after adjusting with the resistance knob. All other attributes are what I'd expect from a low-cost HOTAS. Low build quality overall, which isn't surprising. Wire joining the throttle to the stick should be a bit longer.
customer_reviews.author: TheMinervanConquest

customer_reviews.title: Ideal
customer_reviews.text: Granted, this is my first flight stick, but the price was right and the response is very spot on. Works great on Windows 7 with Steam FSX, and has sufficient weight and grip to prevent slipping. If you are attempting to control the game strictly based on the mouse and keyboard, even this low priced accessory will add a higher value of experience.
customer_reviews.author: Zuul

product_meta.title: Thrustmaster T-Flight Hotas X Flight Stick (PS3 & PC)
product_meta.description: Thrustmaster is a designer and manufacturer of interactive entertainment hardware and accessories for PC and game consoles. Wide hand-rest for optimal comfort. Programmable: the 12 buttons and 5 axles are entirely programmable. (**) This joystick is not distributed under licence or with the approval of Microsoft Corporation / Ubisoft / 505 Games. Configurations by default: PC : Flight Simulator X (**) Microsoft PS3 & PC : Tom Clancy’s HawX (**) Ubisoft PS3 : IL-2 Sturmovik Birds of prey (**) 505 Games. Unique: Plug & Play for ultra-simple and fast installation with all functions pre-configured for immediate takeoff (without worrying about configuration). Detachable, real-size, ergonomically-designed throttle control. Exclusive "MAPPING" button: all functions may be instantly switched around between each other. Dual-system aerodynamic control: by rotating handle (with integrated blocking system) or by progressive tilting lever. High-precision joystick with adjustable resistance. Trigger for brakes (civil flight) or for rapid fire (military flight) + multi-directional hat (panoramic view). Internal memory: to save all of your programming, even with the joystick disconnected. Weighted base for greater stability. Exclusive "PRESET" button": to switch, while playing, instantly from one programme to another
